intro: Clinopodium majoranifolium, commonly known as sweet cicely, is a herbaceous plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves that resemble those of majorana, giving it its scientific name. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. Its aromatic, licorice-scented leaves are used in culinary and medicinal applications. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or meadow habitats.
